HTMLElementBr.summary: The <br> HTML element produces a line break in text (carriage-return). It is useful for writing a poem or an address, where the division of lines is significant.

remarks.para: As you can see from the above example, a <br> element is included at each point where we want the text to break. The text after the <br> begins again at the start of the next line of the text block.

blockquote.para: Note: Do not use <br> to create margins between paragraphs; wrap them in p elements and use the CSS 'margin' property to control their size.
